item.title: Photo 04-03-2023
What to do in life
item.description: I dont have to figure out what to do in life, I just have to figure out how do I kill time untill I find what to do.

item.title: ENDLESS RAIN
item.description:
Perpetual rain, on the homepage.
[rain]

item.title: No more page view counter, A dedicated updates/musings page
item.description: I removed the view counter as it used to take hold of the page focus and redirect to some adverts as soon as the user clicked the page. Also I added a dedicated links page here So that people can view the updates and musings in a better way, so yeah now we have a dedicated cheapo ripoff brokeass twitter copy.

item.title: Cluttered Households, Depressed Grandmothers
item.description:
Cluttered households are merely victimes of consumerism.
Victims of consumerism that could not cope with it. Consuming too much to be clean, consuming to little to be minimalist

item.title: Jab the eyes
item.description:
Gouge them out, eyeballs.
Someone tries to beat you up gouge them out. Lobotomize them.

item.title: Back to the old website
item.description: With a will that shall bring end to all careerism, I ascend to this webpage to claim whats rightfully mine. What was I doing back there, no man thats not how things are done, back to the old webpage. I hope that the other one is forgotten with time.

item.title: Why didn't I learn CSS Grid and Flexbox before ?
item.description:
After months of having wonky broken div's, boxes and elements on my webpage I finally learnt CSS Grid and Flexbox. HTML's never been better.
Folks, better learn flexbox and grid if you dont know it. LEARN IT NOW. Its a boon to mankind.

item.title: Second thoughts on Hugo
item.description: yeah hugos great and all but this html page with the bash scripts isnt bad either I dont think I'll be swithing too soon.

item.title: Back to the old webpage
item.description:
Well, the Hugo webpage did come off great and works like a charm but its going to take me a while to deploy it to github pages.
Hence, coming back to the old ways.

item.title: What 'masturbation is to sex' is what 'memes are to comedy'
item.description: ....Funny memes as comedy is masturbation. Masturbation being a clever monkey manipulation for the mechanic orgasm. Old comedy–stand up and the subtler social performances before that–were more akin to sex, still mechanic, sometimes mechanic-spiritual but a cathartic back and forth....

item.title: Bye Bye Rolling blog page
item.description: I found the rolling blog page to be very irritating and decided to replace it with the blog index.

item.title: Vice: A Series of Forgotten Photos Capture What Life Was Like in 1980s India
item.description: ......The year was 1978. India was reeling from a decade of brutal war, political turmoil and economic unrest. Even so, the streets were alive with the collision of people from all walks of life. Decadent cabaret striptease clubs were all the rage. Religious festivals brought out a jubilant sense of community, even though the societal fabric was frayed by extreme inequalities.....

item.title: Article: Hotel Staffers Tell Us the Weirdest Things They Have Seen Rich People Do
item.description: ....."The horse had to follow him everywhere, whether he was eating or shitting. It was only on the second or third day that we found out he had developed an unhealthy, almost sexual, infatuation towards the horse." .....

item.description: A guestbook for the website, and maybe a webpage view meter as well.

title.a: Grinding the soul into dust: Extracurricular activites in Indian schools

item.description: ....Rather than enable spontaneous but restrained self expression, they were compelled to robotically make hand gestures at particular phrases and artificial pauses (an old radio trick for dramatic emphasis)..... Might as well call them currycular activites
New morning theme added. Taking us to a total of 4 themes. Yeah right, talk of minimal now !
Time dependenent pixel art themes have been added to the webpage. I hope you all like them.

item.title: The one nation, one language fallacy
item.description: Mrinal Kaul writes: India has never done justice to its linguistic diversity or focused on quality language learning. Languages, instead, have become instruments of exercising hegemony.

item.title: No one can be forced to get vaccinated… Centre’s current policy not arbitrary: SC
item.description: ....Upholding an individual’s right to bodily integrity and to refuse to get medically treated, the court said that “no individual can be forced to be vaccinated” but added that “in the interest of protection of communitarian health, the government is entitled to regulate issues of public health concern by imposing certain limitations.”....
So lets get some old web energy flowing with these retro-ey gifs
